formalText: She is tired and cranky and not feeling well.
Emotionally
and physically.
She has had a headache all day, but it's been resistant to painkillers both over-the-counter and prescription.
Dave and her have been fighting a lot the last couple of days.
She has been feeling really low and her mood has been lower the past week and a half to two weeks than it has been in quite a while.
She told him she was feeling low and that she was just really upset about a lot of things and she has been having his meltdowns at the end of the day.
They're almost like a little kid having a meltdown.
It's just that they're too tired and they need to go to sleep.
But they refused to it's the same sort of completely losing all grip on reality and feeling like everything is overwhelming and she can't do anything.
She really tries to keep them bottled up and not expose him to it, but she doesn't know.
She has been tired of having this shaky Edge on my self-control the last week or so.
She was telling Dave she was really frustrated that she couldn't get to sleep because this is so stupid.

He woke her up less than an hour after she finally dropped off to ask her to move over because she was taking up too much space in the bed. Then she did not get back to sleep at all that night. He woke her up at 5 and then she was just up and couldn't get back to bed when he finally rolled out of bed at 8:30.
She thinks that was totally unfair don't ever do that again.

She knows it's not fair to him if she takes up more space on the bed and maybe he should have to gone sleep on the couch. That's not fair, but she needs to be able to sleep and she has so much trouble sleeping.
He just went off at her and yelled at her about how she wasn't doing anything about her sleep problems.
He had told her to try vitamin D because that would fix her sleep problem.
Right, so they started yelling that she didn't want to try this vitamin D thing and she said that he is suggesting that she takes something like 12 times FDA recommended allowance of vitamin D.
He got really mad at her about that.
Then a few days later.
She told him that she was feeling bad enough that she was worried for her safety.
She was afraid she would hurt herself.
He just started yelling at her again.

He told her she was selfish and she wasn't thinking about his feelings. He wishes that he could believe that she loved him, but he can't because if she did she wouldn't be thinking about suicide and it would destroy his world.
Things have been rough with David and her. She doesn't know what to do about it because she knows living with her isn't easy.
She is a pain in the ass to live with in some regards.
He kind of has a point.
About it selfish with her to kind of dumped all her internal Chaos on him and not provide better buffering and to rely on him as much as she does not sustainable and not fair to him.
It drives her crazy.
He won't tell her what he's feeling.
Can he put his thoughts together by then and then he won't he claims that he doesn't need to see a therapist to he's had a relationship with his doctor since 2005.
He sees him once every three months and it's mostly just to prescribe meds.
He has ADHD.
So he takes Concerta which is one of those drugs for you kind of have to go see a physician in person every 3 months because of FDA regulations.
He also does psychoanalysis therapy sort of stuff?
He's not just a prescriber, but Dave refuses to go in for therapy to talk about some of the stuff.
He won't tell her how he's feeling until he blows up at her and accuses her of not loving him.
It's really frustrating.
She is utterly overwhelmed.
She is close enough to actually be contemplating making plans.
Fighting off suicidal urges
She was really isolated throughout her entire childhood.
She had no friends at all.
She was tormented at school tormented at home, but
even at her happiest in the last 10 years or so.
There's always been a thought in the back of her head at things are good now but don't expect them to stay good.
She can always kill herself tomorrow if they stopping good.
She can always change her mind about living tomorrow.
She is kind of sick of having that thought always in her head.
She feels like it's always a really really hard time.
It's an endless hard time.
She saw a doctor Morgan, but she didn't like him at all.
She missed an appointment because she screwed up her calendar and was too embarrassed to call and tell him that she recorded it wrong.
That was in October.
He said that they sell the notes that he got for her previous psychiatrist myself reported symptoms.
He didn't think she needed antidepressants anymore.
He wrote her a script for Ativan
to use on an as-needed basis.
She hasn't run out that script yet because she hasn't actually felt the need for it.
He said he wanted to check in again in six weeks.
So we did and he said sounds good.
Nothing has changed.
He said to check in again in six weeks and that's the appointment she missed.
She got really aggressive about monitoring her sleep hygiene and telling me she had terrible sleep hygiene and to do better and the sleep problems would just go away if she followed the rules better.
The first time she wanted to kill herself, I was 11.
She ate a pack of her parents cigarettes.
It was not a very pleasant plan.
There was the time she thinks, it was last winter when she was pretty close to taking some pills.
It was why she fired my previous therapist.
There was a lot that she didn't like about the treatment plan that she had of the straw that broke.
The camel's back was that she had been wanting to kill herself to the point where she was hoarding pills and she got scared and have to ask Dave to come home.

She took them and hid them and she completely blew that off and redirected the conversation talking about her dad and why he is the way he is. She was kind of armchair diagnosing him from a distance, Which she certainly doesn't have enough insight into what's going on to provide enough symptoms for
She is also worried that if she lets other people know just how bad things are.
They will use that to take advantage of her.
There's The Chronic NeverEnding stresses her parents which waxes and wanes is that again waxing and waning but never fully going away.
She has anxiety around friendships and do people actually want her around and what is my value and all of that?
They have to get these nuts for this trip to China and her dad won't make up his mind whether he wants to deal with getting visas for everyone or whether he wants her and Dave to get their own.
She emailed him to stay the trip is in 4 months.
They need to get our visas.
She sent me this really nasty email back saying that she doesn't know why this is such a big deal for her whether she sends them to the travel agent or whether her dad sends them.
Why does she care, stop bugging.
She has a hard time understanding her dad because he mumbles see an email at least has a record of what is said that has a hard time understanding her because she doesn't know.
He says her English isn't clear enough for him that she talks too fast and uses too many big words, even though she makes every effort when she is talking to him to speak slowly and clearly
Her dad makes a big deal of him not being a native English speaker, even though he learned English when he was 8 years old and has been speaking it since then and speaks fluently.
She thinks he just uses it as an excuse, but with the written word, he can read it if he doesn't understand and there's no wall.
Also it matters because she doesn't want to just send a passport to travel agent.
She needs a booking code or something so that the travel agent knows who these passports are for.
The default is LA and they have to pay more to go from Chicago or Boston.
Her dad said they didn't know her schedule.
She is booking a strep.
The schedule is determined by the flight from LA.
She'll book the fucking flight from Boston to La give her the contact info for the travel agent.
There were three emails in a row from her to Dad saying give her the info for the travel agent so she can book us from Boston to LA.
She hates my parents.
That's all.
Maybe he does have PTSD that's quite likely given his history, but there is nothing she can do about that.
She told him she was feeling really bad and she was really upset about the whole insomnia situation and that it's not getting any better.
She has so much trouble getting to sleep staying asleep.
It's just I can't sleep ever.
She'll be completely exhausted at work, at her desk falling asleep or sitting at home in her home study or on the couch not enough as soon as she gets to bed.
She is wide awake and she can't get to sleep.
It's really frustrating.
She is first in bed usually between 11 and midnight.
She eventually conks out.
She usually wakes up two or three times a night.
Depending on how much sleep she has gotten and how much willpower she has between 7 and 8.
She is sleeping about 5 hours or so with two or three interruptions in an ongoing way.
She was trying to Ambien, but it just doesn't knock her out.
She tried trazodone which is an antidepressant not and hypnotic what it does.
The problem with that is even at the smallest doses 1/4 of the smallest tab that is manufactured.
It will knock her out, but then she'll sleep for 10 hours and feel hungover when she wakes up.
She has the same problem with Benadryl.
She has been getting 5 hours a night with two to three interruptions for years.
On weekends, generally Saturday mornings,
she'll just not turn on the alarm and she'll sleep and get 10 or 12 hours.
Wake up at 10:30 or 11.
She doesn't know how she could get her sleep cycle to move earlier.
It should be a simple thing because she is waking up between 7 and 8 and one would think she would just fall asleep after 16 hours of being awake, but no.
